conclusion: To determine if Object A and Object B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the slopes of their velocity-time graphs at that specific time.
The slope of a velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
For Object A, at \( t_1 \), the graph shows a decreasing slope (downward slope).
For Object B, at \( t_1 \), the graph shows an increasing slope (upward slope).

premise: If the slopes of the velocity-time graphs for both objects are identical at \( t_1 \), then they have the same acceleration.
conclusion: From the image, it is clear that the slope of Object A is negative (decreasing velocity), while the slope of Object B is positive (increasing velocity).

premise: Since the slopes are not the same (one is positive and one is negative),
conclusion: the objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
